intro: Hedyotis leptocaulis, commonly known as the slender-stemmed inchplant, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant features small, opposite leaves that are typically ovate to lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Hedyotis leptocaulis thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth or along stream banks.
